name: Runeboggle
text:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Ever try to count hyperactive schoolchildren while someone shouts random numbers in your ear? It's like that."
—Geetra, frustrated mage

name: Rune-Cervin Rider
text:
Flying
{G/W}{G/W}: Rune-Cervin Rider gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Things of beauty are in constant peril. The riders whisk them to safety, ahead of the encroaching darkness.

name: Runechanter's Pike
text:
Equipped creature has first strike and gets +X/+0, where X is the number of instant and sorcery cards in your graveyard.
Equip {2}

editions.flavor: As sharp as its bearer's words of faith.
Bears aren't always as strong and as mean as you imagine. Some are even stronger and meaner.

"Nature has grown tired of the impositions of men and will begin to outfit its creations with tools for bloody instruction."
—Hadi Kasten, Calla Dale naturalist
Bears aren't always as strong and as mean as you imagine. Some are even stronger and meaner.
The only honey it wants is the sweet nectar flowing through your veins.
The magic of the elves leaves its mark on the forest. The magic of the forest leaves its mark on the animals who live there. The animals of the forest leave their mark on all who trespass.

name: Runed Arch
text:
Runed Arch enters the battlefield tapped.
{X}, {T}, Sacrifice Runed Arch: X target creatures with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

name: Runed Halo
text:
As Runed Halo enters the battlefield, name a card.
You have protection from the chosen name. (You can't be targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything with that name.)

name: Runed Servitor
text: When Runed Servitor dies, each player draws a card.

editions.flavor: Scholars had puzzled for centuries over the ruins at Tal Terig. Its secrets had always lived within one rune-carved head.

name: Runed Stalactite
text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 and is every creature type.
Equip {2}

editions.flavor: When a changeling adopts a form no other changeling has taken, a rune appears in the caverns of Velis Vel to mark the event.
When a changeling adopts a form no other changeling has taken, a rune appears in the caverns of Velis Vel to mark the event.

name: Runeflare Trap
text:
If an opponent drew three or more cards this turn, you may pay {R} rather than pay Runeflare Trap's mana cost.
Runeflare Trap deals damage to target player equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.

name: Runehorn Hellkite
text:
Flying
{5}{R}, Exile Runehorn Hellkite from your graveyard: Each player discards his or her hand, then draws seven cards.

editions.flavor: Inscribed with runes that predate the dragon, its horns possess their own ancient magic.

name: Rune of Protection: Artifacts
text:
{W}: The next time an artifact source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

name: Rune of Protection: Black
text:
{W}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

name: Rune of Protection: Blue
text:
{W}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

name: Rune of Protection: Green
text:
{W}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

name: Rune of Protection: Lands
text:
{W}: The next time a land source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

name: Rune of Protection: Red
text:
{W}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

name: Rune of Protection: White
text:
{W}: The next time a white source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

name: Rune-Scarred Demon
text:
Flying
When Rune-Scarred Demon enters the battlefield, search your library for a card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: The litany of the infernal on his flesh pulses to the beating of his dark heart.

name: Rune Snag
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2} plus an additional {2} for each card named Rune Snag in each graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"Concentration is key. Without it, a mage conjures nothing but a splitting headache."
—Zur the Enchanter

name: Runes of the Deus
text:
Enchant creature
As long as enchanted creature is red, it gets +1/+1 and has double strike. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
As long as enchanted creature is green, it gets +1/+1 and has trample.

name: Runesword
text: {3}, {T}: Target attacking creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn. When that creature leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice Runesword. If the creature deals damage to a creature this turn, the creature dealt damage can't be regenerated this turn. If a creature dealt damage by the targeted creature would die this turn, exile that creature instead.

name: Rune-Tail, Kitsune Ascendant
text: When you have 30 or more life, flip Rune-Tail, Kitsune Ascendant.

name: Rune-Tail's Essence
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to creatures you control.

name: Runewing
text:
Flying
When Runewing dies, draw a card.

editions.flavor: In the hands of the open-minded, a runewing quill writes wisdom of its own.

name: Runic Repetition
text: Return target exiled card with flashback you own to your hand.

editions.flavor: "What some call obsession, I call the quest for perfection."

name: Runner's Bane
text:
Enchant creature with power 3 or less
When Runner's Bane enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

name: Run Wild
text: Until end of turn, target creature gains trample and "{G}: Regenerate this creature."

editions.flavor: Wirewood's beasts didn't seem to mind when the elves moved in. In fact, they hardly noticed them underfoot.

name: Rupture
text: Sacrifice a creature. Rupture deals damage equal to that creature's power to each creature without flying and each player.

editions.flavor: All creatures have an inner fire. Releasing it can be dangerous.

name: Rupture Spire
text:
Rupture Spire enters the battlefield tapped.
When Rupture Spire enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you pay {1}.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

name: Ruric Thar, the Unbowed
text:
Vigilance, reach
Ruric Thar, the Unbowed attacks each turn if able.
Whenever a player casts a noncreature spell, Ruric Thar deals 6 damage to that player.

name: Rushing River
text:
Kicker—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand. If Rushing River was kicked, return another target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.

name: Rushing-Tide Zubera
text: When Rushing-Tide Zubera dies, if 4 or more damage was dealt to it this turn, draw three cards.

editions.flavor: Cut off from the kakuriyo by the destruction of their honden, the zubera sought new ways to bring their secrets home.

name: Rush of Adrenaline
text: Target creature gets +2/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Scarecrows only go so far in sending the message to stay away.

name: Rush of Battle
text: Creatures you control get +2/+1 until end of turn. Warrior creatures you control gain lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by those Warriors also causes their controller to gain that much life.)

editions.flavor: The Mardu charge reflects the dragon's speed—and its hunger.

name: Rush of Blood
text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is its power.

editions.flavor: Sometimes it's not for sustenance or to feed the dependence. Sometimes it's just to feel again.

name: Rush of Ice
text:
Tap target creature. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
Awaken 3—{4}{U} (If you cast this spell for {4}{U}, also put three +1/+1 counters on target land you control and it becomes a 0/0 Elemental creature with haste. It's still a land.)

name: Rush of Knowledge
text: Draw cards equal to the highest converted mana cost among permanents you control.

editions.flavor:
"Limitless power is glorious until you gain limitless understanding."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

"Limitless power is glorious until you gain limitless understanding."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

name: Rush of Vitality
text: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains lifelink and indestructible until end of turn. (Damage dealt by that creature also causes its controller to gain that much life, and it can't be destroyed by damage or effects that say "destroy.")

editions.flavor: Short lives lead to forbidden choices.

name: Rushwood Dryad
text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

editions.flavor: To a dryad, every tree in the forest is both a doorway and a window.
To a dryad, every tree in the forest is both a doorway and a window.
Rushwood is a living jewel that reflects its dwellers' hearts.

name: Rushwood Elemental
text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Rushwood Elemental.

name: Rushwood Grove
text:
Rushwood Grove enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Put a storage counter on Rushwood Grove.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Rushwood Grove: Add {G} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

name: Rushwood Herbalist
text: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Regenerate target creature.

editions.flavor: When generals gather their armies, healers gather their herbs.

name: Rushwood Legate
text: If an opponent controls an Island and you control a Forest, you may cast Rushwood Legate without paying its mana cost.

editions.flavor:
"The wolves of our valley are bred to detest the scent of ghouls. For centuries they have kept our estates clear of such carrion."
—Olivia Voldaren

name: Rust
text: Counter target activated ability from an artifact source. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)

editions.flavor: "How dull it is to pause, to make an end,/ To rust unburnished, not to shine in use,/ As though to breathe were life!" —Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "Ulysses"

name: Rusted Relic
text: Metalcraft — Rusted Relic is a 5/5 Golem artifact creature as long as you control three or more artifacts.

editions.flavor:
"We consider rust a curable disease."
—Tarrin, Hammer-Tribe shaman

"We consider rust a curable disease."
—Tarrin, Hammer-Tribe shaman

name: Rusted Sentinel
text: Rusted Sentinel enters the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor: It has to deliberate a moment on the best way to break your face.

name: Rusted Slasher
text: Sacrifice an artifact: Regenerate Rusted Slasher.

editions.flavor:
"It's a beautiful vision. Discarded debris is reborn as a singular entity."
—Urabrask the Hidden

name: Rust Elemental
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice an artifact other than Rust Elemental. If you can't, tap Rust Elemental and you lose 4 life.

name: Rustic Clachan
text:
As Rustic Clachan enters the battlefield, you may reveal a Kithkin card from your hand. If you don't, Rustic Clachan enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
Reinforce 1—{1}{W} ({1}{W}, Discard this card: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.)

name: Rusting Golem
text:
Fading 5 (This creature enters the battlefield with five fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Rusting Golem's power and toughness are each equal to the number of fade counters on it.

name: Rustmouth Ogre
text: Whenever Rustmouth Ogre deals combat damage to a player, you may destroy target artifact that player controls.

editions.flavor: It has an iron stomach. Literally.

name: Rustrazor Butcher
text:
First strike
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

editions.flavor: A Bloodwort's blade is salted with blood and peppered with rust, seasoning and slaughtering in a single swipe.

name: Rust Scarab
text: Whenever Rust Scarab becomes blocked, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment defending player controls.

editions.flavor:
"Behold nature's answer to the problem of society."
—Nikya of the Old Ways

name: Rustspore Ram
text: When Rustspore Ram enters the battlefield, destroy target Equipment.

editions.flavor: Where herds have passed, the dented ground is lined with piles of rust.

name: Rust Tick
text:
You may choose not to untap Rust Tick during your untap step.
{1}, {T}: Tap target artifact. It doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Rust Tick remains tapped.

name: Ruthless Cullblade
text: Ruthless Cullblade gets +2/+1 as long as an opponent has 10 or less life.

editions.flavor: She wields a blade as bloodthirsty and elegant as herself.

name: Ruthless Deathfang
text:
Flying
Whenever you sacrifice a creature, target opponent sacrifices a creature.

editions.flavor:
"Bring forth the dead, their skull-grins and rattle-bones. We will feast upon their wailing ghosts."
—Silumgar, translated from Draconic

name: Ruthless Disposal
text:
As an additional cost to cast Ruthless Disposal, discard a card and sacrifice a creature.
Two target creatures each get -13/-13 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Do try to pull your weight, Geralf. I feel like I'm doing everything."
—Ghoulcaller Gisa

name: Ruthless Instincts
text:
Choose one —
• Target nonattacking creature gains reach and deathtouch until end of turn. Untap it.
• Target attacking creature gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: A single battle affects countless others.

name: Ruthless Invasion
text:
({R/P} can be paid with either {R} or 2 life.)
Nonartifact creatures can't block this turn.

editions.flavor:
"For the survival of our people, every conflict must now end in retreat."
—Pythor, Mirran resistance

name: Ruthless Ripper
text:
Deathtouch
Morph—Reveal a black card in your hand. (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Ruthless Ripper is turned face up, target player loses 2 life.

name: Ruthless Sniper
text: Whenever you cycle or discard a card, you may pay {1}. If you do, put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

editions.flavor: "You may feel a slight sting."

name: Rysorian Badger
text: Whenever Rysorian Badger attacks and isn't blocked, you may exile up to two target creature cards from defending player's graveyard. If you do, you gain 1 life for each card exiled this way and Rysorian Badger assigns no combat damage this turn.

name: Ryusei, the Falling Star
text:
Flying
When Ryusei, the Falling Star dies, it deals 5 damage to each creature without flying.

name: Saber Ants
text: Whenever Saber Ants is dealt damage, you may create that many 1/1 green Insect creature tokens.

editions.flavor: They stay on the battlefield only long enough to consume the losers.

name: Saberclaw Golem
text: {R}: Saberclaw Golem gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The warriors of the Blade Tribe charged the golem, twenty strong. They returned numbering ten . . . and a half.

name: Sabertooth Alley Cat
text:
Sabertooth Alley Cat attacks each turn if able.
{1}{R}: Creatures without defender can't block Sabertooth Alley Cat this turn.

editions.flavor: It has eight lives' worth of hunger to satisfy.

name: Sabertooth Cobra
text: Whenever Sabertooth Cobra deals damage to a player, he or she gets a poison counter. That player gets another poison counter at the beginning of his or her next upkeep unless he or she pays {2} before that step. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)

name: Sabertooth Nishoba
text: Trample, protection from blue and from red

editions.flavor: They sneer at the terrestrial dangers found on peaks and shores, eager to prove themselves against new and even mightier foes.

name: Sabertooth Outrider
text:
Trample
Formidable — Whenever Sabertooth Outrider attacks, if creatures you control have total power 8 or greater, Sabertooth Outrider gains first strike until end of turn.

name: Sabertooth Wyvern
text: Flying, first strike

editions.flavor: Most creatures grow out of their baby teeth, but sabertooth wyverns grow into theirs.
Most creatures grow out of their baby teeth, but sabertooth wyverns grow into theirs.

name: Sabretooth Tiger
text: First strike

editions.flavor:
"I fear anything with teeth measured in handspans!"
—Norin the Wary

"Daughter, it is now your turn to hunt the Tiger, and make a blanket of its fur."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain
"Here, kitty kitty. Here, kitty kitty. Aaaaugh!"
To a sabretooth, all men are mice.

"I fear anything with teeth measured in handspans!"
—Norin the Wary

name: Sacellum Archers
text: {R}{W}, {T}: Sacellum Archers deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

editions.flavor: "Our arrows are aimed not at the sacred behemoths but at those who dare to dream of such a trophy."

name: Sacellum Godspeaker
text: {T}: Reveal any number of creature cards with power 5 or greater from your hand. Add {G} to your mana pool for each card revealed this way.

editions.flavor: Her connection to the gargantuans puts her in line to become Anima, a sacred but daunting duty.

name: Sachi, Daughter of Seshiro
text:
Other Snake creatures you control get +0/+1.
Shamans you control have "{T}: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool."

editions.flavor: "The warriors deal in poison and fangs. We shamans remember why our ancestors crawled with their bellies to the earth."

name: Sacred Armory
text: {2}: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Arrive for worship. Leave for war.

name: Sacred Boon
text: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. At the beginning of the next end step, put a +0/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented this way.

editions.flavor:
"Divine gifts are granted to those who are worthy."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

"Divine gifts are granted to those who are worthy."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

"Divine gifts are granted to those who are worthy."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Sacred Cat
text:
Lifelink
Embalm {W} ({W}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of it, except it's a white Zombie Cat with no mana cost. Embalm only as a sorcery.)

name: Sacred Excavation
text: Return up to two target cards with cycling from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: The anointed work the mines without pause, their cartouches instilling them with tireless purpose.

name: Sacred Foundry
text:
({T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.)
As Sacred Foundry enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Sacred Foundry enters the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor: Burning fervor and fearsome skill create a lethal beauty terrible to behold.

name: Sacred Ground
text: Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls causes a land to be put into your graveyard from the battlefield, return that card to the battlefield.

editions.flavor:
"That which knows itself cannot be shaped to another's will."
—Oracle en-Vec
The knight knelt and prayed, first for the sanctity of his land and second for the strength to repel its invaders.
The land will never betray those who gave their lives for it.
The land will never betray those who gave their lives for it.

name: Sacred Guide
text: {1}{W}, Sacrifice Sacred Guide: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a white card. Put that card into your hand and exile all other cards revealed this way.

name: Sacred Knight
text: Sacred Knight can't be blocked by black and/or red creatures.

editions.flavor: "No flame, no horror can sway me from my cause."

name: Sacred Mesa
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Sacred Mesa unless you sacrifice a Pegasus.
{1}{W}: Create a 1/1 white Pegasus creature token with flying.

editions.flavor:
"Do not go there, do not go / unless you rise on wings, unless you walk on hooves."
—"Song to the Sun," Femeref song

"Do not go there, do not go / unless you rise on wings, unless you walk on hooves."
—"Song to the Sun," Femeref song

"Do not go there, do not go / unless you rise on wings, unless you walk on hooves."
—"Song to the Sun," Femeref song

name: Sacred Nectar
text: You gain 4 life.

editions.flavor:
"Over the silver mountains,
Where spring the nectar fountains,
     There will I kiss

And drink my everlasting fill. . . ."
—Sir Walter Raleigh, "The Pilgrimage"

"For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise."

name: Sacred Prey
text: Whenever Sacred Prey becomes blocked, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: To see one is a good omen to the Cho-Arrim.

name: Sacred Rites
text: Discard any number of cards. Creatures you control get +0/+1 until end of turn for each card discarded this way.

name: Sacred Wolf
text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

editions.flavor:
"I raised my bow, and the wolf stared at me. Under its gaze, my finger would not release the string."
—Aref the Hunter

"I raised my bow, and the wolf stared at me. Under its gaze, my finger would not release the string."
—Aref the Hunter

name: Sacrifice
text:
As an additional cost to cast Sacrifice, sacrifice a creature.
Add to your mana pool an amount of {B} equal to the sacrificed creature's converted mana cost.

name: Saddleback Lagac
text: When Saddleback Lagac enters the battlefield, support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two other target creatures.)

editions.flavor:
"A good lagac will carry you through thick and thin. A bad one . . . well, it's a tasty dinner."
—Raff Slugeater, goblin shortcutter

editions.flavor:
"A good lagac will carry you through thick and thin. A bad one . . . well, it's a tasty dinner."
—Raff Slugeater, goblin shortcutter

name: Sadistic Augermage
text: When Sadistic Augermage dies, each player puts a card from his or her hand on top of his or her library.

editions.flavor: "Don't worry. I know the drill."
"Don't worry. I know the drill."

name: Sadistic Glee
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever a creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.

editions.flavor:
"First blood isn't as important as last blood."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

"First blood isn't as important as last blood."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Sadistic Hypnotist
text: Sacrifice a creature: Target player discards two cards. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor: "Victory in the pits is almost as rewarding as the methods I use to achieve it."
"Victory in the pits is almost as rewarding as the methods I use to achieve it."

name: Sadistic Sacrament
text:
Kicker {7} (You may pay an additional {7} as you cast this spell.)
Search target player's library for up to three cards, exile them, then that player shuffles his or her library. If Sadistic Sacrament was kicked, instead search that player's library for up to fifteen cards, exile them, then that player shuffles his or her library.

name: Safeguard
text: {2}{W}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target creature this turn.

editions.flavor:
"I'm amused by wasted effort when it's not my own."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

name: Safe Haven
text:
{2}, {T}: Exile target creature you control.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice Safe Haven. If you do, return each card exiled with Safe Haven to the battlefield under its owner's control.

name: Safehold Duo
text:
Whenever you cast a green spell, Safehold Duo gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Whenever you cast a white spell, Safehold Duo gains vigilance until end of turn.

name: Safehold Elite
text: Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: "I refuse to die—not at the hands of one such as you."

name: Safehold Sentry
text: {2}{W}, {Q}: Safehold Sentry gets +0/+2 until end of turn. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)

editions.flavor: "These bracers were worn by my father and by his mother before him. Boggart fangs have shattered on them. Cinder flames have withered at their touch. While I wear them, the safehold will not fall."
